result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody M. Ritchie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cody M. Ritchie is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cody M. Ritchie was found guilty of Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts - Child Act as Actor/Close Age of Actor and Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody M. Ritchie

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant re early release- no longer in custody
from defendant requesting early release - denied
from DA re sentence adjustment - objection

2:50 p.m. Defendant Cody M. Ritchie in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf294 and 15cf161. Victim rights legislation has been complied with. In 15cf161 State moves to dismiss Count 1 - Granted. In 15cf294 - State moves to amend Count 1 to a violation of 948.10 - Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area,  a Class A Misdemeanor and to dismiss Count 2 - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea. Plea questionnaire filed.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Rielly/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence

In 15cf161- Counts 2 and 3 CC
WHS/POP - 2 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision fees - Remitted
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Obtain/Maintain full time employment.
No unsupervised contact with any female under age of 18.
No use of electronic communication devices unless approved by PO
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.

Count 4
Jail - 30 days with Huber for all purposes - to commence on/before Friday May 20, 2016 at 4:00 p.m. 

In 15cf294- CC to 15cf161
WHS/POP - 2 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision fees - Remited
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Obtain/Maintain full time employment.
No unsupervised contact with any female under age of 18.
No use of electronic communication devices unless approved by PO
Jail credit - 4 days credit
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.

Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 3:26 p.m.

Defendant Cody M. Ritchie in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:42
Calling 15cf161 set for status and 15cf294- arraigment
In receipt of information - waive reading - not guilty plea entered - both cases to be set over for PTC
Bail continued in both cases  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

10:46 a.m. Defendant Cody M. Ritchie in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf161 and 15cf294. State calls Detective Chad Wanta, Oneida County Sheriff/witness sworn/direct by Schiek/witness ID's defendant/Rielly cross exam - Court finds probable cause exists and binds defendant over. 15cf161 to track. Adj. 11:00 a.m.  Arraignment scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

2:41 p.m. Defendant Cody M. Ritchie in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued. Adj. 2:42 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 10:45 am.

No contact with AMK. No access to internet either through cell phones, computers, tablets or any other electronic device. Any electronic devices should be turned over to Oneida Sheriff's Office. No contact with any underage females unless related to defendant.

1:18 p.m. Defendant Cody M. Ritchiein custody in court via video with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan appearing telephonically with leave of court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, - Hogan statement to conflict-need for new counsel to be appointed - Schiek/Hogan statement to bond. Defendant states his address is 3481 Eades Road and he lives with his mother. Court sets $ bond. Defendant requests to keep cell phone - Court denies request. Intra circuit transfer to Branch 2. Adj. 1:33 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
